intro: Cuspidaria simplicifolia, commonly known as the simple-leaved spurwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of simple, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers with five petals, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of leafy stems. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and floral structure make it a distinctive member of its family with ecological and ornamental value.
